snippet: 11-to 14-year-olds need only two doses, not the previously recommended three, to prevent cancers caused by the human papillomavirus....
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention say children 11 to 14 years now need just two doses of HPV vaccine, which protects against cancers, while teenagers and young adults should maintain previously recommended three-dose regimen.
lead_paragraph: 11-to 14-year-olds need only two doses, not the previously recommended three, to prevent cancers caused by the human papillomavirus.

headline.main: Children 14 or Under Need Fewer HPV Vaccine Doses
headline.print_headline: Children 14 and Under Need  Fewer HPV Vaccine Doses

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
